title: Jamie Vardy ‘unfollows Wayne Rooney on Instagram amid Coleen and Rebekah drama’
text:
Caption: Jamie Vardy deletes Wayne Rooney from social media in ?deliberate snub? after Coleen accused Rebekah of leaking stories

pics: Gett

Jamie Vardy has reportedly unfollowed Wayne Rooney on Instagram after feeling ‘distressed’ for his wife Rebekah in the wake of her public feud with Coleen Rooney, according to claims by The Sun.

It’s hard to believe that it’s not even been a full week since mother-of-four Coleen set the world (and the internet) on fire with a damning statement accusing fellow WAG Rebekah Vardy of leaking stories about her to the press.

Seriously, what was our life before this story dropped? All time can now be split into BC (before Coleen) and AD (after drama).

But it seems like footballer Jamie, who currently plays for Leicester City, is less than impressed by Coleen’s decision to publicly accuse his wife of three years of wrongdoing – which she denies – and wants nothing more to do with the Rooney clan.

Representatives for Vardy have denied these claims.

A source close to Jamie reportedly told The Sun (ironically): ‘[Jamie] is totally behind Becky and furious with the Rooneys for the way they have gone about this.

Online commenters named the scandal ‘Wag-ileaks’ and nicknamed Coleen ‘Wagatha Christie’ (Picture: Jean Catuffe/Getty)

‘He and Wayne always got on well and he likes him. But he has made his feelings clear. Cutting him off on social media is a totally deliberate snub.’

They continued: ‘He won’t stand for having his wife hung out to dry in public like this.’

While the story has undeniably been the cause of much hilarity (and endless memes), the accusations have negatively impacted life for Rebekah, with the mum-of-four even being visited by the police after receiving receiving graphic death threats from online trolls.

The 37-year-old, who is seven months pregnant with her fifth child, took to Instagram on Wednesday evening to share some of the disgusting messages she had received, with one reading: ‘F**k you dirty sly c*** I hope that baby dies within you b***h.’

In response, Rebekah simply wrote: ‘Well played.’

No matter your team, Coleen or Rebekah, there’s never any need for that.
